intro: Tapiphyllum discolor, commonly known as the variable tapiphyllum, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its unique, often colorful leaves that change appearance with environmental conditions. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its flowers are typically large and showy, with a distinctive discoloration pattern that sets it apart from other species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
